intro: Psychotria archboldiana, commonly known as the Archbold's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, specifically the island of Hispaniola, where it grows in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Psychotria archboldiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
